definition: consigned to eternal damnation/with no hope of reprieve
surname Wan
ten thousand/a great number
to rob/to plunder/to seize by force/to coerce/calamity/abbr. for kalpa 劫波[jie2 bo1]
(negative prefix)/not/no
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out

sentences.english: I am certain, after 14 years of encounters with the Taliban, that they are not beyond redemption.
sentences.chinese: 遭遇塔利班14年，我知道他們並沒有萬劫不復。

sentences.english: The moment his fingers leave the leather loop of the handle, he will fall off the planet.
sentences.chinese: 他的手指一旦鬆開皮包拎手，就會墜落星球萬劫不復。

sentences.english: Even the doomed eternally, I love you will never change until death.
sentences.chinese: 即使萬劫不復，我亦愛你至死不渝。

sentences.english: Our youth in this rotten stinking struggling, and finally beyond redemption.
sentences.chinese: 我們在這個腐爛發臭的青春裏掙扎，最後萬劫不復。

sentences.english: The threat of criminal prosecution can doom a business.
sentences.chinese: 面臨刑事立案的企業或將萬劫不復。

sentences.english: See skulking Truth to her old cavern fled.
Finally let me in on that love is not allowed beyond redemption.
sentences.chinese: 最終讓我在那不被允許的愛情裏萬劫不復。

sentences.english: Around six months later it started a perpetualdecline.
sentences.chinese: 大約六個月後，它開始了萬劫不復的下墜。

definition: dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
lit. the soul flies away and scatters (idiom)/fig. to be frightened stiff/spooked out of one's mind/terror-stricken
cold-hearted/unfeeling/callous
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
ashamed and unable to show one's face
to smash
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time
to massacre one another (idiom); internecine strife
to learn a lesson from the mistakes of one's predecessor (idiom)
to exaggerate
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
to keep silent
covered all over with cuts and bruises/beaten black and blue/be a mass of bruises
